content.description:
Head directly up to "the hole", then trend up and left past a bolt until you see a short slabby right facing dihedral.  Follow this up and right until you get to a 2 bolt anchor.  No Rap Rings.

This climb is fun because it has short sections of many climbing styles (in order):  lieback, vertical movement, perfect hand jams (the left side of the hollow flake), slab, awkward dihedral (crux).  A microcosm of climbing.

We saw a rattlesnake under a rock at the top, watch out!  Also, the dam makes significant noise, making communication difficult.  Be prepared to yell!
content.protection: Takes gear of all sizes, but be sure to have tiny cams for the top dihedral, which is extremely thin.  1 bolt on the slab.  2 bolt anchor (no rap rings).  Requires a 70 meter rope to setup a toprope.
content.location: Scramble up the hill until you see a giant dimple or "hole" in the rock.  Belay just below the hole.
